greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{k>=1} 1/(4^k - 1).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: Equals Sum_{k>=1} x^(k^2)*(1+x^k)/(1-x^k) where x = 1/4 (the Lambert series evaluated at 1/4). - _Joerg Arndt_, Jun 03 2020
Equals Sum_{k>=1} d(k)/4^k, where d(k) is the number of divisors of k (A000005). - _Amiram Eldar_, Jun 22 2020
mathematica: x = 1/4; RealDigits[ Sum[ DivisorSigma[0, k] x^k, {k, 1000}], 10, 105][[1]] (* after an observation and the formula of _Amarnath Murthy_, see A073668 *)
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Oct 12 2014
